content.description: Sit start on the left, and climb the lip to the tip. Finish off at Sequoia.
content.location: It ascends the right-rising arete before Sequioa.

content.description: Sequoia ascends a gorgeous arete. Sit start on a good right hand sloper with a good foot hold. Move up to the crack. Using the arete with your right hand, reach for some sidepulls out left. High feet in the crack will help. Top out straight up.This is a bit of an eliminate, but it so good. Rocking out right on to the slab is a different problem.
content.protection: Pads and a pad for the rock behind the boulder.
content.location: It climbs the obvious, proud arete on the Peter Pan Boulder left of The Lost Boys.

content.description: Sit start on the very end of the horizontal crack, the very end. Climb left through the horizontal crack, and top out as for The Lost Boys at the arete.
Sit start the beautiful sloper arete. Climb straight up, and top out.

Stand start the face just left of the arete on marginal hands but good feet. Climb straight up. The arete is off. Omit the jug in the crack, and just use the pinch to reach the lip for an okay eliminate.
Stand start the arete to the right of the large tree. Head up to the horizontal crack  and top out after gaining the sloper at the peak.
content.location: This is the left arete when looking at "Happy Thoughts."

content.description: Dawn shares the same sit start to Sequoia but climbs the face to the right with the cherry tree at your back. Place your left hand on the arete not your right.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter for the tree.

content.description: Sit start to the right of "And Humans Loved Stories" at the featured, left-slanting bit. Head straight up to an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad to protect you from rock in the landing zone.
content.location: It is to the right of "And Humans Loved Stories."

content.description: Sit start as for Neverland on the bad crimps. Make a hard move to the jug in the crack, then move straight up through an undercling and slopers. Top out directly above using a cool, knob feature. This has really good climbing. The stand can be done from the undercling and a slopey hold out right at V2.
content.location: Use the same start as Neverland.

content.description: This is the tallest boulder in the cluster. A horizontal crack runs almost all the way through it. This holds the best lines here.
